author: sahnepudding
body:
After updating powershell v6.0.0-beta.6 to v6.0.0-beta.7
the following example command does not work anymore:

var_dump(exec("powershell --help"));
result: string(0) ""

On my production site (powershell v6.0.0-beta.6)
i still get the full output of the help command.
I' am sure it's not a problem with filepermissions on the server.

I would appreciate any ideas.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
does using the absolute file path to the `powershell` binary work? Perhaps PHP doesn't see it in its path, for some reason.

Also, can you please post the output of `$PSVersionTable`?

comments.author: sahnepudding
comments.body:
I just went back to version v6.0.0-beta.6 and the problem still persists on this system. 
So i guess it has nothing to do with the powershell version.
I also used absolute paths for testing and got the same results.

```
exec("powershell -help 2>&1", $out);
var_dump($out);
```

Result: 
`array(7) { [0]=> string(63) "FailFast: Object reference not set to an instance of an object." [1]=> string(0) "" [2]=> string(66) " at System.Environment.FailFast(System.String, System.Exception)" [3]=> string(66) " at System.Environment.FailFast(System.String, System.Exception)" [4]=> string(88) " at Microsoft.PowerShell.UnmanagedPSEntry.Start(System.String, System.String[], Int32)" [5]=> string(63) " at Microsoft.PowerShell.ManagedPSEntry.Main(System.String[])" [6]=> string(7) "Aborted" }` 

$PSVersionTable:

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.6
OS                             Linux 3.16.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.16.43-2+deb8u3 (2017-08-15)
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

comments.author: markekraus
sahnepudding
comments.body:
Thanks for your assist. 
strace -v returns a huge array and actually there are some files and folders which cannot be found.
E.g. "/netcoredeps/tls". But i have no clue why it's missing or how to fix it. The whole strace output can be found [here](http://88.198.80.208/stracepowershell.txt)

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @sahnepudding I believe we determined this is a PHP/Environment issue. I;m going to close this issue. If you can still reproduce this issue in RC.2, please update this issue and I will re-open.

title: php exec/shell_exec does not work with powershell v6.0.0-beta.7
